security_audit.summary: Documentation-only skill containing test execution instructions. Contains bash command examples for running TUnit tests with Playwright. No executable code, no network calls, no file system access beyond standard documentation. Pure prompt-based skill with safe behavior matching stated purpose. All 47 static findings are false positives from pattern matching on documentation text.

content.value_statement: Blazor component testing requires running TUnit with Playwright. This skill provides commands to execute tests, filter by name, run in debug mode, and generate reports.
actual_capabilities: Run all TUnit tests with Playwright
Limit parallel test execution to prevent system overload
Filter tests by class name, namespace, or exact test name
Run tests in debug mode with automatic PWDEBUG=1
Generate test reports in console or TRX format
Apply flakiness mitigation with automatic retries
limitations: Requires .NET SDK and Playwright to be installed
Only works with TUnit test projects using the correct structure
Does not modify test code or create new tests
Debug mode requires a debugger to be attached

faq.question: What is TUnit?
faq.answer: TUnit is a modern testing framework for .NET that provides parallel test execution and flexible filtering.

faq.question: Does this work with WebAssembly tests?
faq.answer: Yes, TUnit and Playwright support all Blazor render modes including WebAssembly and Server-Side Rendering.

faq.question: How many parallel tests should I run?
faq.answer: Start with 1-2 parallel tests. Too many can exhaust browser resources and cause flaky failures.

faq.question: Is my data safe when running tests?
faq.answer: Yes, tests run in an isolated test environment without accessing production data or external systems.

faq.question: Why do tests sometimes fail intermittently?
faq.answer: Playwright tests can be flaky due to timing. The skill includes automatic retries and sequential execution to help.

faq.question: How is this different from other test runners?
faq.answer: This skill is configured for Blazor component testing with Playwright, including accessibility testing.
